content.question: Which of the following describes a process that increases genetic diversity in prokaryotic cells?

choices.label: Chromosomes segregate independently and form different combinations in daughter cells.
Homologous chromosomes exchange genetic material during meiosis.
Conjugation transfers <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> from one cell to the other cell.
A cell infected with two genetically different viruses can produce viruses with new allele combinations.

content.answer: Conjugation transfers <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> from one cell to the other cell.
